result.execSummary:
The defendant Christine M Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied and balance to be paid at the rate of $40.00 a month commencing June 15, 2016 and each 15th of the month thereafter until paid in full.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Def in person & by Atty Jeffrey A Jaeger.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and orders fine of $579.00, bond posted shall be applied and balance to be paid at a rate of $40.00 per month commencing 6-15-16 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
